:::{#hero-heading}

Matthew N. McCall is a tenured associate professor of Biostatistics & Computational Biology, associate professor of Biomedical Genetics, and affiliated faculty of the Goergen Institute for Data Science at the University of Rochester. He is director of the Statistics PhD program, co-director of the Wilmot Cancer Institute Biostatistics and Bioinformatics Shared Resource, and associate director of the Environmental Health Biostatistics Training Grant. 

## Education

- Ph.D., Biostatistics, Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health (2010)
- M.H.S., Bioinformatics, Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health (2010)
- B.S., Statistics, University of Michigan (2004)

:::
